intro: Pavetta lomamiensis, commonly known as the Lomami pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
